headline: Is James Bond an alcoholic?
subHeadline: Guests: Heather Zumarraga, Kris Fried, Kat Timpf, George Murdoch

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: I think we have the greatest base in the history of politics. I have people that I love and that love me frankly that includes a lot of women.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: You're telling me. Yes, so Cohen's up to the clink, how did the media respond? To which I say, so what? I mean, we all knew this guy was shady. He's so shady you could hold a picnic under him, but that's really not on Trump. It's not against the law to have a dirty lawyer nor is it to have a dirty lawyer pays off women you slept with.  In fact, I believe if you're a real estate contractor from Queens, it's in the human resources handbook as mandatory behavior. Step one, sleep with a porn star. Step two, hire a fixer to pay her off. Step three, find another porn star. This is why I'm not running for President. You know what I've noticed, every President has questionable friends who do things for them, who then get into hot water once you're elected. The last thing I want to do is get my slimy dirt ball friends in trouble. I have so many, which is why I'm announcing today that I will not be running in 2020. I know, I know, which means more time for travel maybe to see old friends. I wonder how my college roommates will react. I'll see you soon, little buddies.  Fact is, payoffs are unseemly, but they're not illegal. Even more Trump used his own money unlike the creeps in Congress who tapped our pockets for sexual harassment payoffs, which may be why Nancy Pelosi now agrees with me telling the media to shut the F up.

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: I wish that the press would spend a lot more time on what we need to do here to meet the needs of American people, instead of morning, noon and night allegations against the President.   I think you'll have more viewers or readers if it would address concerns that people have rather than just this ongoing, ongoing coverage of what's current with the President from one day to the next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, slap my face with a tapeworm. Someone's been watching this show because I couldn't have said it better myself. I probably could have, but anyway, but if Nancy gets it, then she must know this collusion crap is going nowhere.   Yes, collusion, remember when that was the big story. Now, it's vanished like a pot brownie at Gary Johnson's house. Nobody remembers Gary. He eats a lot of pot brownies. Yet, the media still keeps saying what about Russia 57 different ways. They're like a talking bottle of ketchup. Anyway, too bad about that meeting earlier this week.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We need border security. The wall is a part of border security. You can't have very good border security without the wall, no.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: Absolutely not true. That is a political promise. Border security is a way to effectively honor our response --

utterances.speaker: CHUCK SCHUMER, U.S. SENATOR, NEW YORK, DEMOCRAT
utterances.sentences: And the experts say you can do border security without a wall, which is wasteful and doesn't solve the problem.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: It totally solves the problem.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now, the media went nuts, but I loved it. Of course, every time Trump acts like Trump, the media's hair catches fire, which I think might be a threat to public safety. Here you have a normal conversation between adults and the media gets in a tither, which I think is German for leather bodysuit.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I think that she was saying no bands leaning here. Let me remind you who I am.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS MATTHEWS, ANCHOR, MSNBC
utterances.sentences: What do you make of Trump's posture sitting in that room, the way he sits the whole --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: He always sits that way though.

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: What would you call that? What would you call that?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I don't know. He's like --

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: The man spread or whatever you call it. Look, he widens his legs as far as possible, man spreading or whatever, man splaying ...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Chris has not, not lost it. Amazing, it's like none of these people know people who call them out on stuff. Could that be it? Are they all living in their parents basements talking to their cockatoo? But Nancy and Chuck badly wanted the wall discussion done privately, while Trump's like, "No, let's do it here." He had nothing to hide, but they did. It was almost as if he knew he was right and poor Chuck, everyday morphing into the penguin from Batman. So true. Meanwhile, these guys are working on their act for Vegas.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS CUOMO, ANCHOR, CNN
utterances.sentences: The President went toe-to-toe with his new foe and he got Nan Chucked.  His new foe, the Nan Chuck. I like because it sounds like you know, the martial arts.  Do I get an amen on my new nickname of Nan Chuck. Don Lemon gave it to me. I was going to go with Paluma.

utterances.speaker: ALEXANDRIA OCASIO-CORTEZ, AMERICAN POLITICIAN, DEMOCRAT
utterances.sentences: Don, that's terrible.

utterances.speaker: CUOMO
utterances.sentences: With Paluma or Schmalosi.   I have Paluma and Schalosi.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, ANCHOR, CNN
utterances.sentences: Nan Chuck went over well.

utterances.speaker: CUOMO
utterances.sentences: You were right about that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wow, they really are the Lenny and Squiggy of cable news, without the Lenny, they're both really Squiggy. Now, I get it, Trump made them that way, but overlooked in all of this - this guy. Yes, Mike Pence. As stoic as an Easter Island attraction, undertakers tell him to loosen up. He kind of reminds me of me when I watched Sarah Silverman tell a joke, but really, he's just doing his part, to represent Trump's grandest promise, a wall. He became at that moment, a wall. And Trump was saying if we don't have a wall, I'm just going to send a thousand Pence's to the border. They will all lock arms and remain motionless. Although, you know what? Looking at Pence, I do wonder what the hell was he thinking?

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: Well, thank you, Mr. President for the opportunity to meet with you --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: God, "The Greg Gutfeld Show" is so funny. I wonder what that guy is like? I bet he's awesome.  I bet he would be fun to go fishing with. But I'd need a boat. Should I buy a boat? I don't live near water. Does that matter? Will Greg think I'm weird if I have a boat and I don't live near water? He'll probably make fun of me. I mean, if I get the boat first, I can move closer to the water, or should I move closer to water then get the boat? Then the boat salesman will see me a mile away, "Whoa, look at this guy, he just moved near water. He's probably going to buy a boat." This is a bad idea. If Greg only likes me because I have a boat, then I don't need his friendship. He's really not my friend after all. Greg's a big stupid jerk and I hate his big stupid face.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wow. That was good. While most of us saw this as another week, others still get so dramatic. Some said things you could lose your job over or worse, that I could lose my job over.

utterances.speaker: MIKA BRZEZINSKI, HOST, MSNBC
utterances.sentences: Is that a patriot speaking or a wannabe dictator's butt boy?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She called the Secretary of State an anti-gay slur, of course she apologized faster than you could say Joy Reid, but it sucked on Twitter, so she apologized again.

utterances.speaker: BRZEZINSKI
utterances.sentences: The term is crass and offensive and I apologize to everyone especially the LGBTQ community and to my colleagues for using it. It was a mistake, my father would have found it so unbecoming and disrespectful and he would have told me, I will work hard to be better.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now, we should accept the apology. People like Mika who don't accept apologies are jerks, but boy, I could safely say, if it were me who said it, I doubt you'd say forgive and forget. I'd have more pitchforks in me than the farm supply aisle at Home Depot.  But the incident kind of tells you something because the daughter of a diplomat like she said, she's a symbol of elitism and the establishment cocktail circuit and the word that comes to her mind about a Secretary of State is that word, meaning, she'll be fine. She's protected.  For two years, Trump has been accused of saying awful things, but nothing quite like that. "Morning Joe" truly has become a race to the bottom. Let's welcome tonight's guests. He puts the fine in Finance, stock market guru and financial analyst Heather Zumarraga. He's so funny, strangers slap his knee, writer and comedian Kris Fried. She's bold likes to scold and complains about the cold, "National Review" reporter, Kat Timpf. And Niagara Falls is his drinking fountain, former WWE Superstar, my massive sidekick and host of "UnPC" on Fox Nation, Tyrus. All right, Heather, what was your take on that whole wall meeting done in public?  HEATHER ZUMARRAGA, SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT, VISION 4 FUND: Loved it. I couldn't stop watching. One part that wasn't shown is Pelosi said we're going to call this a Trump shutdown and under his breath, he said, "Well I was going to call it a Pelosi shutdown," but everyone was happy as soon as Chuck Schumer - Chuckie Schumer said, "Will you please acknowledge that this time you take credit for the shutdown," because he had to take credit for it in August. They called it a Schumer shutdown and he said, "You know what, Chuck, I'll take credit for it." So this time, as long as he takes credit for Chuck and Nancy are happy. They're off the hook, that's all they cared about.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's true and by the way, and that's always Trump's kind of motto is that he'll take the heat. He doesn't mind. I mean, it can't get much worse. The heat is already hot, Kris, much unlike you, thanks for dressing down.

utterances.speaker: KRIS FRIED, WRITER AND COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: Welcome.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Were you helping your friends move before you got here?

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: I was. No, later, tonight.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Are those sweatpants?

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: They are not. They're my first ever black jeans in life.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, you know what black jeans are, they're sweats. Tight sweats, Kris.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: Next time, I'm going to wear actual tights.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I hope you do. Maybe, that's my goal is to get you into tights.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: Yes, I've heard that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What? Kris, what do you make of the week?

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: How's my Mika impression?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that was very good. A very good Mika impression. What did you make of the week? You picked Mika and Pelosi ...

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: With that meeting, I really enjoyed - so he - Trump baits people in.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: Everyone acts like, you know, shutting down the government, it sounds bad. He's really ruining America. He knows people are going to freak out and then it's going to work itself. He treats - he talks to them like a family going to Disney and he's like, "I'll turn this car around." And they go, "No, no, you can't. No." And he's like, "I'll do it. I'm going to shut it down." It will work out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, in fact, I don't mind the government shutting down, Kat. I don't - I think you would agree with me.

utterances.speaker: KAT TIMPF, REPORTER, NATIONAL REVIEW
utterances.sentences: I do agree with you, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Okay, next question.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I do agree with you.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: On my pants --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: And also, I don't think that anybody who supports Trump is going to care even if it is his shutdown and he says it's his shutdown because it's for border security and that's one of the things he ran on that was so important to a lot of the people and the reason why a lot of people voted for him, so they're probably happy to see a Republican actually standing up for things rather than just caving like a lot of the Republicans have in the past.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Tyrus, last word. GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, HOST UNPC, FOX NATION: I think the biggest thing was - first of all, I'd like to give Nancy Pelosi some kudos here because this is why the media didn't want her back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right, you're right.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: This is why - because she came to work. She came to work with the President of the United States and that's why they were making fictitious people to run against her like she doesn't have the vote, right, because - R. MacDonald is going run against her for. Like they were trying to create havoc because she's literally like, "Let's work with the President." So kudos to her for that. And this is very simple with the wall, it's a campaign promise which is a huge reelection chip.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: So he's - on the things he's done well, tax reform, foreign policy and stuff like that, those are things in his bag that when reelection starts, he's like, I've done this, I've done this. Healthcare, not. But if he has a visual, please, turn your to the screen and look at the beautiful wall we built. It's a little hard to run against that because I'm pretty sure --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Can't run into it.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: They could run into it. it would be a huge problem, so if they say no, no, no and if lightning strikes and that they win, I'd guarantee you, the first thing they'll do is be like, "We're going to put in a wall." But they'll call it a standing apparatus to deter migrant workers from getting over. Like it's going to be - it's going to be a different, name but the wall -- Hillary was for the wall, everyone was for the wall. It's just because it's - it'll go - it will go credit to him and it will really kind of lock in his reelection.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you know what I think that Trump has it backwards. He keeps saying, we're going to build the wall and have Mexico pay for it. My theory is, Mexico builds the wall and we pay Mexico because what does Mexico need? Jobs, right? Build it on the side of Mexico, you have no more eminent domain problems and we're outsourcing the jobs. Thank you. Unfortunately, I am not running for President because I have too many strange friends. Coming up, the Academy Awards can't get anyone to host the Oscars. We discuss the note - the job that no one wants. It's looking like a lonely Oscars ceremony. The Academy Awards show may go without a host this year because Kevin Hart bailed on the job after the Twitter mob came after him for stuff he said years ago and after that, who in Hollywood wants to go near this radioactive mess? The PC police have made it their mission to target - target shame anyone who might rise to the top of any career. We live in a world now where scalping careers online is a full-contact sport. So who can host the Oscars? Maybe you're the one person who doesn't tweet stupid stuff or has had no scandals, made no edgy jokes, is amazingly inoffensive. Who could that be? I just like to watch his face rise like the moon. All right, Kris, you're a comedian or so you claim, it's kind of - I mean, the Oscars are having a hard time finding a host who doesn't have any kind of past, so what would you suggest?

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: Well, my pick would be Trey Parker and Matt Stone - South Park guys or Norm MacDonald. They would never do it, but my real solution would be Martin Short.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: Because he's hilarious and everyone loves him. He can still do song and dance. He's just as good as he's always been. He's classic, you know, I think he would bring people together.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know what they're going to do because the guy that they basically shamed out, Kevin Hart, over a homophobic tweet they're going to have to go with a gay host and I would say, it would be probably Doogie Howser -- okay, I can't remember his name, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: It would be him playing Doogie.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I don't have to know his name, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I just - because maybe I thought you might remember that show.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I never watched that show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Neil Patrick Harris.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Good for you. It's like someone was in your ear.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what, if every person had one of these things, you will you be so smart.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Tyrus, how do you feel about this? Does this bother you?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I think it's great that people are taking a stand and not want to be the next man up after him. We've talked about this, I was talking about this earlier today like the pay is not that great. It's like 15 grand to host, but you know, I think the PC police should get their hero. I mean, Michael Avenatti should do the show. He needs the money.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He does.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: He needs the money.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But you know, he can't drive there because they repossessed his car.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I'm sure they can put car service involved.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: And then he can talk for like what? Two hours?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I mean, no one is going to watch anyway, so I mean like --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's the size and shape of the Oscar.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Right and he can come and it'll be a great night. They'll make great predictions on who's going to win of course, all the predictions are wrong. The other guy will win and it will be a great night for the PC police, champion, of course, until he's carted off because of the salt stuff. But I mean, I think that's the only person -- they're going have to get somebody as we like to say in my neighborhood, who's really thirsty. It's going to have to be a really thirsty person or Martin Short actually would be a great choice, but he's too smart to do it. So, I mean unless you're going to jump in and save the day, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, no. I've got plans that night. I'm watching the Oscars. Kat, I'm laughing at my own joke.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I know. I would do it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you would do it.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: But only for the attention. I mean, I don't really get the whole watching the Oscars thing anyways. It's basically a party that you're not invited to.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's true.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: If someone throws a party and they don't invite me, I'm not like, "All right, well at least there's a window." You know, I'm not like, "Okay, great. If I can still watch it and then just tweet about it from afar, that sounds like a fun night." I don't understand it at all. Because there's just a bunch of people showing that they're better than you and look at all of my expensive clothes and look at my expensive life and watch me cry on TV. If I wanted to watch somebody cry, I just look in the mirror.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She's got a point. You know, Heather, she's got a point like it's just a bunch of self-congratulation for very needy people. They have most of what they want, but they're still insecure and miserable.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: How come Kevin Hart can't get away with that kind of joke, but Mika can?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's a - because she's white.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: That's a double standard, isn't it?

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: See.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Greg gets it, thanks for coming out. Roll credits. He got it. He got it.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: Yes, $15,000.00 isn't a lot of money. I don't know who's going to step up to the plate to take that, both Jimmy Kimmel and Kevin Hart were willing to because they say it's a stepping stone to boost your career, right, to take it to the next step. I don't really think they need it. So maybe, I think they'll get a lesbian comedian. We talked about this earlier, Wanda Sykes, I think will may satisfy the LGBT community. She's next in line, so we'll see if she takes it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, didn't Ellen DeGeneres do it once? I can't remember.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: I think so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: See this is what happens. All of a sudden, we're sitting here talking about identities. We're not talking about who should - oh, she's a good host, who could be funny. We're talking about, all right who fit - who ticks the boxes? That's where we are in this world, America and I'm not sure I'm supporting it. You can take that to the bank. Hey, that's a good idea for a segment. By the way, I just got the new Jasper calendar. There are four pictures on every page. She couldn't figure out 12. She had 48. What's wrong? According to new medical research, James Bond was a dangerous drunk, but according to James Bond, new medical research sucks.

utterances.speaker: ANITA VOGEL, FOX NEWS
utterances.sentences: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Anita Vogel. President Trump touting the accomplishments of his administration during the Congressional Ball this evening.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: No administration has done more in the first two years than the Trump administration which is many of the folks. When you think about the tax cuts and the regulation cuts and all of the things that have happened including two great new Supreme Court justices and what people don't know is that we've almost reached the 100 mark of Federal judges. That's a big, big mark. The President also encouraged guests to admire the White House, calling it a happy place. I'm Anita Vogel, now back to "The Greg Gutfeld Show."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: To you he's a sexy spy, to them he's just a drunken guy. Researchers claim James Bond has a serious drinking problem and should seek help. It's fiction. They watched 24 Bond movies. This was an excuse and counted Bond at 109 drinks or about four and a half per film. That is like half a night for me and when he drinks, Bond engages in all sorts of risky behavior like fighting - fiction - driving - fiction -high-stakes gambling - it's made up - operating heavy machinery, contact with dangerous animals and having sex with enemy agents - fiction. Now, the lesson here is, yes, alcohol can lead to bad choices, but the researchers suggests that - is it MI-6? Or M1-6? MI-6 should become a more responsible employer and change its workplace drinking culture, which might however, make the next Bond film look like this.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This Christmas, Bond is back like you've never seen him before.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You hungry? I had an extra one.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You're not --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Of course not. Violence is so uncivilized.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It's the same James Bond you know and love, rewritten to please even the most progressive socially conscious movie goer in 2018.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: What will it be, sir? Let me guess? Martini, shaken not stirred.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Latte, soy latte. Extra decaf.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Extra decaf?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Are the beans sustainably sourced? I only drink organic farm raised homegrown cruelty-free coffee.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I have no idea.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: With intrigue in suspense.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Your move 007.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Is it? No, seriously, is it? I don't know how to play this game. I saw it at a TED Talk recently that competitive activities only encourage toxic masculinity and marginalized disenfranchised communities into unjust hierarchical structures reinforced by a bigoted and corrupt system.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You're bluffing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What's a bluff?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And it isn't a Bond film without seduction.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Well, James, I've had a really lovely evening. Care to come inside?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You know, I don't appreciate the heteronormative assumptions in your proposition. It's regressive anti-neo feminist rhetoric like that that perpetuates a patriarchal society of oppression and gendered subjugation, not the least of which, I care to contribute to.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You could have just said "No."

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: So get ready for the most politically correct secret agent of all time. No guns, no gambling, no girls. It's James Bond in "The Spy Who Consensually Agreed In Writing She Loved Me."

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You must be Q?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's LGBTQ now.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: But of course.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I make a terrible Q, by the way. Oh geez. Let's go - Kat, who's going to watch James - a James Bond teetotaler.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: No one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Is that the word? No one.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: No one. I'm just picturing like the next one is just him sitting at Passages Malibu in like a support group. I would not watch that unless it were hosted by Dr. Drew. It's like a job that Dr. Drew could do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And she'll shoehorn it into a Bond segment.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
